title: Arcade Missions
body:
I'm all for free stuff, thanks Rito.

But why make both (free) mission chains map dependent?

I only play ARAM (for years), I could count the number of Rift games I've played since season 3 on one hand. I haven't played a single 'normal' game in at least 2 years. Got about 7k ARAMs under my belt.

Now, I'm at mission 3 on both chains, and have to play rift to complete them.
This sucks, I've long since forgotten about farming/last hitting, Rift strategy and such. I'm just a team fight all day, every day kinda guy.

I feel bad for any team that gets matched with me on the Rift, I doubt I'll be much help.
Maybe if I stick to jungling, it won't be so bad...

/sadpanda.jpg

replies.body: You really think Riot is going to cater to the special people who mess around on ARAM every day? I don't see how you can play League and find SR to be such a problem, its the main map of the game. I'm not saying you're forced to play SR when you play League but it's only natural for missions to be completed on SR when that's what 99% of the players play on.

Did you know that 87% of statistics are made up? (including this one)
Many people mostly, or exclusively play ARAM, I have a friendslist full of them.
OFC you don't see them if you main SR.

You totally underestimate the ARAM crowd, it's not only a more fun game, there's less QQ as well.

Hey! You must try toplane, you will learn a lot about farming and about the rift. When I started playing on pre season 3, I did just play at twisted treeline por several years until season 5, and I always played as support for my cousin that teached me the game, but he insisted on me to play on the rift and finally I did. I enjoyed it, and I started discovering all new lanes and champs that had always been there for years.

Only parts of missions are map reliant. Not actually sure if any are directly tied to the ARURF game mode.

I'm more than happy to complete missions in Normal/Ranked SR or ARAM or 3v3 but I detest (AR)URF.

They're SR reliant.
I haven't played normal/ranked SR in years (literally).
So I play ARURF and it's just down to who hits the jackpot in team select.
Then you have an OP team and win, but it's over too quickly to complete the minion based missions.

Have to say, that this "event" puts me off LoL, rather than encourages me.
I feel compelled to try and complete missions if I'm playing, and I'm having less fun than if I was just playing ARAM as per usual.

Thankfully, new Hearthstone expansion just came out, so I'm having fun with that.

Sorry man, I think the reason that they did that is because ARAM games usually go faster than normals and, in the Omega Squad mission line, people were going into ARAM/Ascension to do them.

Sorry man, but I can't see them changing that.

ARURF games tend be over just as quickly, or even faster than ARAMs.
So, cool story?

I haven't hit level 3 yet, so I can't check what the exact wording is. Does the mission explicitly state that it has to be a "standard" or "normal" SR match, or does it just state "SR"? If it doesn't specify that it has to be "standard/normal", then you should be able to complete the missions via ARURF, which is a lot more laid back than normals (and, in my opinion, the single closest featured mode to ARAM). I'd be happy to queue with you for some ARURF (or even normals) if you'd like.

As for making missions map dependant, there was a section regarding that aspect of missions in the recent [Ask Riot](http://nexus.leagueoflegends.com/2017/08/ask-riot-missions-and-tacos/) post, where they said something like "queue restricted missions were a noticeably failing trend", so it may be that they're trying it out with SR queues rather than ARAMs, since that tends to be more popular. Not to mention, the Arcade Accents may have played a part in them wanting to "push" players towards SR based modes.
It definitely seems to be no specific queue, as long as it's on an SR map, so URF included. I just now got credit for a win playing URF on a level 3 mission.
I know, because AR URF is PVP and it's a SR game. My point was just to say that unless it does specifically say PVP, it can be done in bots games as well. ;)

If it doesn't specifically say PVP in SR (which a few of them d0), they can be done in Co-op vs. AI games as well. 
But I know where the OP is coming from. I personally don't enjoy SR games, so I usually just did quests in ARAM. And right now, ARURF doesn't seem to be helping much for the 'winning' quests...
I made a comment but HeartVine already said the same thing pretty much haha
